title: Firefox Password Fill-In stopped working.
content: Its very simple, I have a bunch of Saved Log in and Passwords saved in the place I'm supposed to save it. Starting yesterday for some reason Firefox stopped doing the Fill-in part. I've check all my info and its all still in there it just isn't getting from there to my Log In screens like it should? And to cut out this needless babble, it is NOT my computer! Cause guess what, I also have Chrome and my saved password function works just fine with them. Which is why I have both, it must be a really funny Business Lunch where you and Google flip a coin to see who is going to play dumb this week.
creator: sercouwis2004

title: Scroll pagine Facebook impazzito
content: Scroll delle pagine Facebook impazzito. Sembra viva di vita propria. Difficoltosa la consultazione dei posts. Un problema di java scripts? Come risolvere?

title: firefox is not using my configured cursor in ubuntu.
content: Normally when I am not using Firefox My cursor is different (I have changed it in settings). Yet when I use Firefox It changes to Ubuntu's Default cursor. I don't know what type of information is required but I will happily provide them if you tell me about them.
creator: ubuntuhussain149

title: Thunderbirdin sähköpostien salasanat
content: On kaksi Elisa -operaattorin ja Thunderbirdin s-postiohjelmaa koneellani, joista toinen meni tilaan, johon loppui viestien tulo. Myöhemmin toisenkin kävi samoin. Ei myös pysty lähettämään, vaan aina kysyy uudelleen salasanaa ja ilmoittaa: "Salasanan lähettäminen ei onnistunut. S-postipalvelin mail.kolumbus.fi vastasi: Authention failed." Elisan avustajapalvelut eivät kykene selvittämään ongelmaa. On kuitenkin olemassa outlookin osoite, johon voi lähettää mahdolliset neuvot: vjh@live.fi
creator: vjh2

title: want to access a site turning off "connection not secure" blocking
content:
I am trying to help a friend set up her web site. To do so I need to access her pages under development. She uses a composer assistant. The produced pages are compliant with http not httpd. They will be ported, eventually. But, for now, I need to override disable "connection not secure" for ONE site. I tried disable HTTPS-Only Mode in Firefox to no avail. What's next to try? (Please don't say trash Firefox unless that's categorically impossible and the only solution.) If I had more time I'd scarf the source and start Hacking. Please, someone offer a usable simple solution.

Current Firefox auto-updated and Current Windows 10 auto-updated
creator: Leonaragolosa

It just showed up yesterday and I don't think I've added anything to the computer to make this happen. But it's really frustrating. I do appreciate any help you can offer. Thank you.

title: Sometimes restores older session
content:
Firefox 105.03 (64-bit) Windows 11 Pro version 21H2

Using Firefox restore session, sometimes this restores the previous session (correct), but occasionally it restores a session from weeks earlier (wrong). Why and how to stop it doing this?
creator: pamelap1

title: Scroll wheel click no longer works in Firefox exclusively
content:
Ever since yesterday, scroll click (I use it to scroll through websites) has stopped working in Firefox. Works in in programs, other browsers, etc., just not Firefox.

Whats weird is it still registers a click when I use it, so I can lick on links with it if I want, but the function of scrolling, either by clicking once and using my mouse to go up and down, or by clicking an holding, no longer works.

I've tried disabling add-ons, incognito mode, nothing seems to work.
creator: firefox.6hauh

title: Firefox is not working
content: Several nights ago I shut down as normal and had not been having any issues. When I booted the next morning everything had gone haywire. I could not open any bookmarked in Firefox. I would click on a link in my Most Visited bookmark and a tab would open but nothing would happen. I could click on a link in an e-mail (Thunderbird) and the same thing would happen. I am able to run MS Edge without any problems. My Firefox version is 105.0.3 (64-bit) and my windows version is Win10 Pro version 21H2. I cannot figure out what has happened and don't want to lose Firefox.
creator: AZCowboy

title: Snooze Posts

title: Download and Add Bookmark windows are huge.
